key: MDAID_狼騎士団長のターバン
MDAID_H_狼騎士団長のターバン
value:
A traditional headscarf from Wolf.
It is similar in fashion to those worn
by the horsemen of the plains people.

key: MDAID_狼騎士団長のターバン・極
MDAID_H_狼騎士団長のターバン・極
value:
A traditional headscarf from Wolf,
similar to the one he was given by
Hardin, to whom he swore allegiance.

A horseshoe charm from Roshea. It is
thought to bring good fortune among
the calvary. The end is real horse hair!

A horseshoe charm from Roshea. It is
thought to bring good fortune among
the calvary. A time-honored tradition!

A cup from Vyland, full of significance.
Roshea and the others received the
same when they all swore their oaths.

A cup from Vyland, full of significance.
It is extravagant, adorned with jewels,
illustrating Vyland's trust in you.

A cloth eyepatch from Malice. With its
rough edges, it looks incredibly cool.

A cloth eyepatch from Malice. It seems
her father gave it to her after he won it
gambling. Is it...safe to take it?

Finish all turns to complete a game of Pawns
of Loki.

or higher with an infantry ally.

or higher with a cavalry ally.

or higher with an armored ally.

or higher with a flying ally.

40 or higher with an infantry ally.

or higher with an armored ally.

Defeat Gangrel: Plegia's Mad King at level 40

or higher with an infantry ally.

Defeat Jorge: Traveling Peddler at level 40
or higher with a cavalry ally.

Defeat Petrine: Icy Flame-Lancer at level 40
or higher with an armored ally.

Win Arena Duels at any difficulty.

Clear Book V, Chapter 12: Part 1 on Lunatic
difficulty with a sword ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 12: Part 2 on Lunatic
difficulty with a lance ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 12: Part 3 on Lunatic
difficulty with an axe ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 12: Part 4 on Lunatic
difficulty with a sword ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 12: Part 5 on Lunatic
difficulty with a lance ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Leader of the Coyote's Men of Aurelis. He has
pledged an oath of loyalty to Hardin. Appears in
Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem.

Member of the Coyote's Men of Aurelis. After
the War of Shadows, he retired from the army
but eventually returned to the field. Appears in
Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem.

A capable mercenary who works together with
her father, Dice, who in turn loses most of their
earnings gambling. Appears in Fire Emblem:
New Mystery of the Emblem.

Member of the Coyote's Men of Aurelis. To him,
Wolf, Sedgar, and Roshea are considered to be
nothing less than brothers. Appears in Fire
Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem.

Second in command of the Coyote's Men of
Aurelis. Alongside Wolf, he fights with the pride
of the plains people. Appears in Fire Emblem:
Mystery of the Emblem.

Princess of Nifl, the Kingdom of Ice. A woman
who keeps much of her thoughts to herself.
She has become a champion of Nifl, God of Ice,
and so has been granted a portion of her power.

Reduces ranged damage with Special
and adds that damage to her attack.
Also intercepts nearby ranged attacks.

Wields a bow that is able to follow-up
immediately after his own attacks.
Can also invert nearby foe bonuses.

Her weapon grows stronger with
Dragonflowers, and she can block
penalties to Special cooldown!

His weapon can reduce the damage
he takes from his foe's first attack!
Has advantage when near allies.

Accelerates Special trigger (cooldown count-1).
If unit initiates combat or is within 2 spaces
of an ally, grants bonus to Atk/Spd/Def/Res
during combat based on the number of times
unit has been enhanced using Dragonflowers
(one or more times grants +6, zero times
grants +4), and also, if unit has been enhanced
using Dragonflowers two or more times,
neutralizes effects that grant "Special cooldown
charge +X" to foe or inflict "Special cooldown
charge -X" on unit during combat.

At start of combat, if unit's HP ≥ 50%, grants
Atk/Def+5 during combat, and also, if foe can
make a follow-up attack, reduces damage from
foe's first attack by 50%.

At start of combat, if unit's HP ≥ 50%, grants
Atk/Def+5 during combat, and also, if foe can
make a follow-up attack, reduces damage from
foe's first attack by 50%.

If unit is not adjacent to an ally, inflicts
Atk/Def-5 on foe during combat and
neutralizes foe's bonuses to Atk/Def (from
skills like Fortify, Rally, etc.) during combat.

If unit is not adjacent to an ally, inflicts
Atk/Def-5 on foe during combat and
neutralizes foe's bonuses to Atk/Def (from
skills like Fortify, Rally, etc.) during combat.

Grants Atk+3. Effective against flying foes.
At start of combat, if unit's HP ≥ 25%, grants
Atk/Spd+6 to unit during combat, and also, if
unit initiates combat, unit can make a follow-up
attack before foe can counterattack.

Effective against flying foes. If unit initiates
combat, grants Atk/Def+4 during combat and
foe cannot make a follow-up attack.

Effective against flying foes. If unit initiates
combat, grants Atk/Def+4 during combat and
foe cannot make a follow-up attack.

Neutralizes effects that guarantee foe's
follow-up attacks during combat. At the
start of turn 1, if foe's attack triggers
Special, grants Special cooldown count-1.
If foe's attack triggers Special and Special
has the "reduces damage by X%" effect,
Special triggers twice. (Example: if Special
has the "reduces damage by 50%" effect
and no other damage reduction effects
trigger, reduces initial damage by 50%,
then reduces remaining damage by 50%
for a total damage reduction of 75%.)
Each Special trigger is calculated as
a separate activation.

Neutralizes effects that guarantee foe's
follow-up attacks during combat. At the
start of turn 1, if foe's attack triggers
Special, grants Special cooldown count-1.
If foe's attack triggers Special and Special
has the "reduces damage by X%" effect,
Special triggers twice, then reduces damage
by 5. (Example: if Special has the "reduces
damage by 50%" effect and no other damage
reduction effects trigger, reduces initial
damage by 50%, then reduces remaining
damage by 50% for a total reduction
of 75%. Remaining damage is then reduced
further by 5.) Each Special trigger is calculated
as a separate activation.

Neutralizes effects that guarantee foe's
follow-up attacks during combat. At the
start of turn 1, if foe's attack triggers
Special, grants Special cooldown count-2.
If foe's attack triggers Special and Special
has the "reduces damage by X%" effect,
Special triggers twice, then reduces damage
by 5. (Example: if Special has the "reduces
damage by 50%" effect and no other damage
reduction effects trigger, reduces initial
damage by 50%, then reduces remaining
damage by 50% for a total damage reduction
of 75%. Remaining damage is then reduced
further by 5.) Each Special trigger is calculated
as a separate activation.

If a movement Assist skill (like Reposition,
Shove, Pivot, etc.) is used by unit or targets
unit, inflicts Def/Res-2 on nearest foes within
4 spaces of both unit and target through their
next actions.

If a movement Assist skill (like Reposition,
Shove, Pivot, etc.) is used by unit or targets
unit, inflicts Def/Res-4 on nearest foes within
4 spaces of both unit and target through their
next actions.

If a movement Assist skill (like Reposition,
Shove, Pivot, etc.) is used by unit or targets
unit, inflicts Def/Res-6 on nearest foes within
4 spaces of both unit and target through their
next actions.
